item.title: Blaise add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I will keep the law given by God; sanctioned by man. Laws and principles are not for the times when there is no temptation: they are for such moments as this, when body and soul rise in mutiny against their rigour; stringent are they; inviolate they shall be. If at my individual convenience I might break them, what would be their worth?" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Emily Jane Brontë
item.description: "A good heart will help you to a bonny face, my lad and a bad one will turn the bonniest into something worse than ugly." -- Emily Jane Brontë

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "True life is lived when tiny changes occur." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I sit on a man's back choking him and making him carry me, and yet assure myself and others that i am sorry for him and wish to lighten his load by all means possible....except by getting off his back." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Things are always different than what they might be...If you wait for them to change, you will never do anything." -- Henry James

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Trifles make the sum of life. " -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Blaise add a quote by ernest hemingway
item.description: "Courage is grace under pressure." -- ernest hemingway

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Jim Collins
item.description: "Good is the enemy of great." -- Jim Collins

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "The trail is the thing, not the end of the trail. Travel too fast, and you miss all you are traveling for." -- Louis L'Amour

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Blaise add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain
